choices.D: Analyze, describe, and document the requirements for the subsequent Sprints.
choices.E: Create at least one valuable, useful Increment.
choices.B: Define the major product features and a release plan architecture.
choices.A: Make up a plan for the rest of the project.
choices.C: Build at least one piece of valuable functionality.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CE
D is incorrect
Based in Scrum Guide 2020 C & E

Selected Answer: CE
Agree with C & E

Selected Answer: CE
C and E

<B. Définir les principales fonctionnalités du produit et une architecture de plan de version.
E. Créez au moins un incrément précieux et utile.

Lors du premier Sprint, l'équipe Scrum travaille sur une sélection de fonctionnalités préalablement définies dans le Product Backlog, et elle doit se concentrer sur la création d'un incrément de produit fonctionnel, utile et potentiellement livrable. L'équipe commence également à planifier la manière dont les fonctionnalités seront développées et livrées dans les versions futures (plan de version), ce qui est essentiel pour guider le développement tout au long du projet Scrum. Les autres options ne sont pas des activités typiques du premier Sprint.

Selected Answer: CE
C And E!

Selected Answer: CE
that's the answer

Selected Answer: CE
Agree with C & E
Right answer is C & E
It should be CE

questions.question_text: Which two things should the Scrum Team do during the first Sprint? (Choose two.)

choices.C: Never. All Developers on the Scrum Team share accountability for items in the Sprint Backlog.
choices.D: At Sprint Planning when all of the Sprint Backlog items are split evenly across the Developers.
choices.B: As soon as a Developer on the Scrum Team can accommodate more work.

questions.question_text: When does a Developer become accountable for an item in the Sprint Backlog? (Choose the best answer.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C.development team is accountable.

choices.B: When the Sprint Retrospective is complete.
choices.A: When all Product Backlog items meet their Definition of Done.
choices.D: When all the tasks are completed by the Developers.
choices.C: When the Product Owner decides enough has been delivered to meet the Sprint Goal.

discussion.content: When the timebox expires = When the Sprint Retrospective is complete.

Selected Answer: B
When sprint retrospective is completed.

Correct Answer is B - When the Sprint Retrospective is complete. According to the Scrum Guide, A Sprint is timeboxed and is over whenever its timebox expires. The Sprint Retrospective is the final event of the Sprint, hence it concludes the Sprint.

questions.question_text: When does a Sprint conclude? (Choose the best answer.)
What does it mean to say that an event has a time-box?

choices.D: The event can take no more than a maximum amount of time.
choices.C: The event must take at least a minimum amount of time.
choices.A: The event must happen at a set time.
choices.B: The event must happen by a given time.

discussion.content: D is correct

Selected Answer: D
Answer D
Option D is correct.
D is the correct answer

questions.question_text: What tactic should a Scrum Team use to divide a group of 100 people into multiple Scrum Teams? (Choose the best answer.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Scrum teams are self managing.

comments.content: Scrum teams are desired to be feature team not the component team.

discussion.content: C is the correct answer

choices.C: Create teams based on their skills across multiple layers (such as database, UI, etc.)
choices.B: Ask the Product Owner to assign the people to teams.
choices.A: Ask the people to divide themselves into teams.
